title: Innovations
text: My work involves developing open-source tools, cloud applications, and browser extensions to streamline geospatial workflows for researchers and data scientists.

title: Innovations
text:
üåç Earth Engine Apps


 ::: {.software-card-body} ### Spectral Reflectance Curve Analyze spectral signatures across multiple bands for precise land cover characterization. ::: {.card-footer}  Visit App  GitHub


:::

 ::: {.software-card-body} ### Phenology Signature A specialized tool for crop classification utilizing phenological signatures and time-series analysis. ::: {.card-footer}  Visit App  GitHub

::: :::

 ::: {.software-card-body} ### Flood Susceptibility Implementing Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP) for rigorous flood risk assessment and mapping. ::: {.card-footer}  Visit App  GitHub

::: :::

 ::: {.software-card-body} ### Odisha Flood Map Visualizing regional flood extent using multi-date satellite imagery for immediate response support. ::: {.card-footer}  Visit App  GitHub

::: :::
:::

title: Beyond Google Earth Engine: Exploring Open Source Options
text:
Google Earth Engine (GEE) has revolutionized the way we handle petabytes of satellite imagery. However, as the field of Spatial Data Science matures, many researchers are looking for open-source alternatives that offer more flexibility, data sovereignty, and integration with modern AI frameworks.
In this post, we explore the ‚ÄúBeyond GEE‚Äù ecosystem‚Äîa combination of cloud-native formats, distributed computing, and powerful programming libraries.


The backbone of the modern open-source stack is the Cloud Optimized GeoTIFF (COG). Unlike traditional TIFFs, COGs allow for ‚Äúrange requests,‚Äù meaning you only download the specific pixels you need.
Complementing this is STAC (SpatioTemporal Asset Catalog). It provides a common language to describe geospatial datasets, making data discovery across different providers (Microsoft Planetary Computer, AWS, etc.) seamless.



If you miss the ‚Äúinstant‚Äù scalability of GEE, the Pangeo ecosystem is your answer. By combining Xarray (for multidimensional arrays) with Dask (for parallel computing), you can perform heavy-duty analysis on your own cluster or local machine.

Check out: odc-stac for loading STAC items into Xarray objects.




The Planetary Computer is perhaps the strongest competitor to GEE. It provides a massive catalog of open data and a managed JupyterHub environment (the Explorer and Hub). Since it‚Äôs built on STAC and Xarray, it provides a much more ‚ÄúPythonic‚Äù experience compared to GEE‚Äôs JavaScript-centric API.



For those who prefer keeping data local or working on smaller scales: - Python: libraries like geopandas, rasterio, and rioxarray have become the industry standard. - R: The terra and sf packages offer incredible speed and reliability for spatial operations.



Exploring open-source options isn‚Äôt about replacing GEE entirely‚Äîit‚Äôs about adding more tools to your belt. Many of my innovations, like deepgee, actually serve as bridges between the GEE cloud and the local open-source Python ecosystem.
By mastering both, you become a more versatile Spatial Data Scientist, capable of handling data wherever it lives.

What is your favorite open-source spatial tool? Let me know in the comments!

title: Welcome To My Academic Blog
text:
Welcome to the Spatial Geography Hub
Welcome to my updated personal website and blog! I am thrilled to share my journey as a geographer and spatial data scientist with a global community of researchers and developers.
This blog will serve as a space for: - Courses: Deep dives into Google Earth Engine, Python, and R for geospatial analysis. - Project Updates: Behind-the-scenes looks at the development of my innovations like geeadvance and deepgee. - Field Notes: Insights from workshops, research conventions, and academic fieldwork.
Since this is a platform for geographers, expect to see a lot of satellite imagery, code snippets, and spatial insights. Whether you are a student just starting with GIS or a professional looking for advanced AI-driven spatial tools, I hope you find this content valuable.
Feel free to leave comments using your GitHub account‚ÄîI look forward to engaging in technical discussions and collaborations!

title: Modern GIS with Python: Beyond the Desktop
text: Python has become the de-facto language for spatial data science‚Ä¶

title: Why in Cloud GIS Google Earth Engien is the only option left?
text:
Why Cloud GIS?
The Cloud GIS is the new paradigm in GIS. It is the new way of doing GIS. It is the new way of doing GIS. It is the new way of doing GIS. It is the new way of doing GIS. It is the new way of doing GIS.
With the advancement of the Google Earth Engine this concept has become more popular.
